articles.title: Repeated Omicron exposures override ancestral SARS-CoV-2 immune imprinting - Nature.com
articles.description: Exposure to early variants of SARS-CoV-2 results in immune imprinting in mouse models and in humans, reducing neutralizing antibody titres against Omicron variants, which could be mitigated with multiple updated boosters.

articles.title: HIV-1 Env trimers asymmetrically engage CD4 receptors in membranes - Nature.com
articles.description: HIV-1 Env trimers bound to one, two and three CD4 molecules are observed at membrane–membrane interfaces between HIV-1 and CD4-decorated virus-like particles.

articles.title: Our brains are not able to 'rewire' themselves, despite what most scientists believe, new study argues - Medical Xpress
articles.description: Contrary to the commonly held view, the brain does not have the ability to rewire itself to compensate for the loss of sight, an amputation or stroke, for example, say scientists from the University of Cambridge and Johns Hopkins University.

articles.title: Polio is on the brink of eradication. Here's how to keep it from coming back - Nature.com
articles.description: The campaign to eradicate polio could succeed in the next few years. But that’s just the beginning of a new challenge — keeping it away.
